intro: Lathyros clymenus, commonly known as the creeping thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its stems are often hairy and can become woody with age, while its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. Lathyros clymenus is typically found in dry, rocky soils and is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
